title: Make “High IQ” installable and distributable in Chrome (PWA + Chrome Web Store-ready assets)

requirements.text: Add Progressive Web App (PWA) support so the “High IQ” site is installable in Chrome (desktop + Android) and behaves like an app (standalone window) when installed.
acceptanceCriteria: A valid web app manifest is added (name: “High IQ”, start_url, display: "standalone", theme_color/background_color aligned to the existing warm theme).
`frontend/index.html` includes the necessary `<link rel="manifest" ...>` and icon metadata so Chrome detects the app as installable.
When served over HTTPS, Chrome shows the “Install app” UI for the site (installability criteria met).

requirements.text: Implement an app icon set suitable for Chrome install prompts and store listing, and ensure the manifest references the generated icon files.
acceptanceCriteria: Manifest references icons that include at least 192x192 and 512x512 PNG sizes.
Icons are included as static assets and load correctly (no 404s) when the app is running.
Icons visually match the existing High IQ branding (using the existing logo style).

requirements.text: Add a service worker to enable basic offline support for the app shell (landing page + core JS/CSS) so the installed app launches reliably even with intermittent connectivity.
acceptanceCriteria: A service worker is registered by the frontend and successfully installs/activates in Chrome DevTools > Application.
On repeat visits, the app shell assets are served from cache when offline (network throttled/offline in DevTools) and a user can at least open the UI.
No backend data corruption occurs due to offline mode; if live data is unavailable, the UI fails gracefully (e.g., shows a clear retry message).

requirements.text: Add a short “Chrome install / publish” documentation file explaining how to (1) install locally in Chrome, (2) package the build for distribution, and (3) submit the PWA to the Chrome Web Store (steps only; no external integrations).
acceptanceCriteria: Documentation is written in English and includes prerequisites, build steps, and where the generated icons/manifest live in the repo.
Documentation explicitly notes what cannot be automated in-repo (e.g., creating a Chrome Web Store developer account and completing the web store submission UI).

constraints: Do not modify files under the immutable frontend paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (compose existing hooks/components instead).
Keep backend as a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; no additional backend services.
Do not add third-party authentication (Internet Identity remains the only auth option).
nonGoals: Actually publishing the app into the Chrome Web Store on the user’s behalf (requires external accounts, manual submission, and approvals).
Building a Chrome Extension (Manifest V3 extension) unless explicitly requested; this request is treated as distributing/installing the web app in Chrome.

required: High IQ app icon, flat vector/mark style, transparent background (high-iq-app-icon.dim_192x192.png)
High IQ app icon, flat vector/mark style, transparent background (high-iq-app-icon.dim_512x512.png)
